name: Rajmohan Rajaraman
content: Rajmohan Rajaraman's home page Rajmohan Rajaraman Khoury College of Computer Sciences Northeastern University initial then first three letters of name at ccs dot neu dot edu 202 WVH Northeastern University Boston MA 02115 Phone: +1-617-373-2075 Fax: +1-617-373-5121 Recent Courses CS 7870Seminar in Theoretical Computer Science: A Modern Toolkit for Algorithms and Analysis (Fall 2023) CS 3000 Algorithms and Data (Fall 2021, Fall 2022, Fall 2024) CS 5800 MS Algorithms (Fall 2018) CS 7880 Network Algorithms (Spring 2016) CS 7800 Advanced Algorithms (Fall 2014) CS 4800 Algorithms and Data (Fall 2014) CS 1800 Discrete Structures (Fall 2011) CS 6710 Wireless Networks (Spring 2010) CSG 714 Theory of Computation (Spring 2009) Research Interests Approximation algorithms, algorithmic game theory, distributed computing, ad hoc and sensor networks. Papers and Tutorials List of papers A series of lectures on network optimization and analysis at the ISI-IMSc Summer School on Network Optimization and Security Tutorial on Introduction to Dynamic Networks: Models, Algorithms, and Analysis Tutorial on Algorithmic Foundations of Ad Hoc Networks Research Group & Seminar Algorithms and Theory group at Northeastern NU Theory Seminar Professional Activities Computing Community Consortium (CCC) Council, since July 2022 Associate Editor: Theory of Computing Systems Associate Editor: International Journal of Foundations of Computer Systems Track Chair: SSS 2014, "Ad-hoc, Sensor and Mobile Networks, Cyberphysical Systems" Program Chair: ACM SPAA 2011 Program Chair: IEEE DCOSS 2010 Vice-Chair: IEEE IPDPS 2010, Algorithms Track; PC Member: ACM FSTTCS 2014; ACM SPAA 2013; ACM-SIAM SODA 2010; ACM PODC 2009; ACM SPAA 2008; IEEE IPDPS 2008; IEEE DCOSS 2007; IEEE FOCS 2006; Co-editor: SICOMP special issue for FOCS 2006; TOCS special issue for SPAA 2002 Treasurer, ACM SPAA 2004-2007 Graduated PhD Students Jiangzhuo Chen (2005, Research Scientist at U. Virginia) Lujun Jia (2005, Verizon) Guolong Lin (2006, Cambridge Mobile Telematics) Laura Poplawski Ma (2009, Raytheon) Zhifeng Sun (2012, Google) Timothy Smith (2015) Scott Roche (2016, Akamai Technologies) Hamid Jahanjou (2019, Google) Lucianna Kiffer (2022, IMDEA Madrid, Spain) Mehraneh Liaee (2022, Google) David Stalfa (2024, Northeastern U. Seattle) Currently Advising Sushant Agarwal, Andisheh Ghassemi, Zeno Kujawa, Amanuel Tesfaye, Omer Wasim
